message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a valuable asset. My initial offer is $1,200,000.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate your enthusiasm, $1,200,000 is still a bit high for me.  I'm interested in the product, but I'm only able to offer $900,000 at this time.

I understand that $900,000 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to compromise. I can meet you halfway and offer the product for $1,050,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, $1,050,000 is still above my budget.  I'm willing to go up to $950,000, but that's my final offer.
I'm not willing to go as low as $950,000, but I'm willing to meet you at $1,000,000. This is my final offer, and I think it's a fair price considering the product's value to you.
Alice, I understand you're firm on $1,000,000. I'm willing to go up to $975,000, but that's my absolute final offer. If we can't reach an agreement, I'll have to consider other options.
I'm not willing to go as low as $975,000, but I'm willing to meet you at $1,025,000. This is my final offer, and I think it's the best we can do considering the product's value to you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further. However, $1,025,000 is still a bit out of my budget.  I'm prepared to go up to $990,000, but that's my absolute final offer. If we can't reach an agreement, I'll have to seriously consider my other options.  I'm confident this is a fair price for both of us, given the value of the product.

I understand you're firm on $990,000, but I'm still not willing to meet you at that price. I'm willing to make one last concession and offer the product to you for $1,050,000. This is my absolute final offer, and I think it's the best we can do.
